newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice closes firm on short covering, harvest.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice closes firm on short covering, harvest.

text.p: CBOT rice closed firm on short covering tied to signs futures were oversold, traders said.
"It was mainly an upward correction from an oversold situation," a trader said.

Rice futures this week dropped on increased harvesting of the U.S. crop, a weak tone in cash markets and reports the benchmark Thai price dropped $10.00 per tonne to close the week at near $335.00 per tonne, they said.
Rice futures closed 1/2 to 2-1/2 cents per cwt higher, with September up 1/2 at $10.07 per cwt.
The market this week also was hit by slow exports. But Friday U.S. export sources said Ivory Coast bought 26,516 tonnes of U.S. No 2 long grain brown rice under PL480.
"We broke to the downside this week and below a two-week consolidation level," a trader said.
He said the market has correctly anticipated the fact of increased supplies of high grade rice in Asia.
"The second Thai crop was high quality which increased the exportable supplies there," the trader said.
Rice futures volume was estimated at 650 contracts, down from 1,031 Thursday. Rice options volume was estimated at 10 contracts, down from 45 Thursday.
